data.title: Identifying the best Dutch soccer players throughout history
data.meta_description: The best Dutch soccer players in football history are known for their versatile football, creativity, and achievements. Check out who is on the list here.
data.text:
The Netherlands has produced some of the greatest soccer players, but only a few rank among the best because of their talents, achievements and contributions to the sport. From Johan Cryuff and Marco van Basten to Arjen Robben and Robin van Persie, we break down the best Dutch soccer players ever and what they did.

The Dutch are known for their beautiful style of football and for producing historical teams that shaped the sport. They have reached the FIFA World Cup finals thrice but never won it. Despite that, their players have achieved much with their clubs and won multiple awards. Let us find out who the best Holland soccer players of all time are and what made them stand out above the rest.

Best Dutch soccer players in history

Holland players are among the most successful in football history. They have won eight Ballon d'Or awards and produced golden generations in the 1970s, late 1980s, early 1990s, and the 2010 class. So, who is the Dutch football hero? Check out the top 10 best Dutch football players and their profiles. The list is in no particular order as each left an indelible mark on the famous sport.

Amazing! The top 10 Everton legends of all time are now revealed

Football

10. Robin van Persie

Van Persie is a familiar figure in football following his achievements with Arsenal and Manchester United. He was part of Holland's 2010 generation that reached the 2010 World Cup final and finished third in the 2014 edition. Van Persie is also the Netherlands' all-time top scorer, with 50 goals in 102 caps.

Date of birth: 6 August 1983

Age: 40 (as of January 2024)

Birthplace: Rotterdam, Netherlands

Career: 2001-2019

Clubs: Feyenoord, Arsenal, Manchester United, Fenerbahçe

Position: Striker

9. Edwin van der Sar

Van der Sar is the second-most capped Holland player with 130 matches. He tops the list of the best Dutch goalkeepers of all time following his achievements and records.

The legendary keeper is a two-time European Goalkeeper of the Year winner, multiple league champion and Champions League winner with Ajax and Manchester United. He also holds the record for the longest streak without conceding (1,311 minutes) in the Premier League (2008-09).

Who has the most assists in Premier League history?

Football

Date of birth: 29 October 1970

Age: 53 (as of January 2024)

Birthplace: Voorhout, Netherlands

Career: 1990-2016

Clubs: Ajax, Juventus, Fulham, Manchester United, VV Noordwijk

Position: Goalkeeper

8. Arjen Robben

Robben was known for his lethal left foot, making him one of the most feared wingers. He was part of the 2010 class alongside Van Persie and Van der Sar. Robben won 32 club titles, including the 2013 Champions League with Bayern Munich. He managed 96 caps and scored 37 goals for the national team.

Date of birth: 23 January 1984

Age: 39 (as of January 2024)

Birthplace: Bedum, Netherlands

Career: 2000-2021

Clubs: Groningen, PSV, Chelsea, Real Madrid, Bayern Munich

Position: Winger

7. Frank Rijkaard

The legendary midfielder had an illustrious career, putting him among the greatest Dutch soccer players ever. Rijkaard spent most of his time at Ajax and AC Milan. He won 21 major trophies for his clubs, including five Eredivisies and two Serie A titles.

Sporting Lisbon legends: Top 10 all-time greats for the Leões

Football

Rijkaard managed 73 caps for the national team and scored ten goals. He was one of the stars of the 80s generation that won the 1988 European Championship.

Date of birth: 30 September 1962

Age: 61 (as of January 2024)

Birthplace: Amsterdam, Netherlands

Career: 1980-1995

Clubs: Ajax, AC Milan, Sporting CP, Real Zaragoza

Position: Midfielder

6. Johan Neeskens

Neeskens is one of the best Dutch midfielders of all time and a member of the 'Total Football' generation in the 70s that revolutionised the game. He was known for his top-notch technical abilities and work rate. The former midfielder won three European Cup titles with Ajax in the 1970s and one European Cup Winners with Barcelona.

Johan Neeskens played 49 games for Holland, scoring 17 goals. He was part of the historic team that finished runners-up in the 1974 and 1978 FIFA World Cups.

Top 20 most underrated footballers of all time: who are they?

Football

Date of birth: 15 September 1951

Age: 72 (as of January 2024)

Birthplace: Heemstede, Netherlands

Career: 1968-1991

Clubs: Racing Club Heemstede (RCH), Ajax, Barcelona, New York Cosmos, Groningen, Fort Lauderdale Sun, Kansas City Comets, Lowenbrau, Baar, Zug

Position: Midfielder

5. Dennis Bergkamp

Watching Dennis Bergkamp play during his peak was a fantastic experience for fans who witnessed his magic touches, controls, and movements. The football legend played as a second striker or attacking midfielder for Ajax, Inter Milan, and Arsenal, establishing himself among the best Dutch football players in the 90s.

Bergkamp lifted three Premier League titles with Arsenal, an Eredivisie Cup with Ajax and the UEFA Cup with Inter, among other trophies. He played 79 games for the national team, scoring 37 goals. Dennis scored one of the best World Cup goals in the quarter-final of the 1998 edition against Argentina, sealing a 2-1 with his last-minute strike.

All-time best: Top 15 left-backs in the world in 2023 ranked

Football

Date of birth: 10 May 1969

Age: 54 (as of January 2024)

Birthplace: Amsterdam, Netherlands

Career: 1986-2006

Clubs: Ajax, Inter Milan, Arsenal

Position: Second striker

4. Ronald Koeman

Koeman was a versatile footballer who could play in defence and midfield. He won over 15 trophies, including the European Cup with PSV and Barcelona. Koeman played 78 games for Holland and scored 14 goals. He was part of the team that won the 1988 European Championship.

The legendary defender was also a prolific goal scorer, finishing his career as the highest-scoring defender in football history with 253 goals. His experience and portfolio elevate his status among the best Dutch soccer players of all time.

Date of birth: 21 March 1963

Age: 60 (as of January 2024)

Birthplace: Zaandam, Netherlands

Career: 1980-1997

Clubs: Groningen, Ajax, PSV, Barcelona, Feyenoord

Position: Defender, midfielder

Who are the best football managers of all time as of 2023?

Football

3. Ruud Gullit

Gullit is one of the famous Dutch soccer players who won the Ballon d'Or (1987) alongside Marco van Basten and Johan Cruyff. Ruud Gullit played as an offensive midfielder for several clubs, including Feyenoord, PSV, AC Milan, and Chelsea, in the 80s and 90s.

The Dutch legend won 16 trophies, including nine with Milan and the 1988 UEFA European Championship with the national team. Gullit registered 66 caps and scored 17 goals.

Date of birth: 1 September 1962

Age: 61 (as of January 2024)

Birthplace: Amsterdam, Netherlands

Career: 1979-1998

Clubs: HFC Haarlem, Feyenoord, PSV, AC Milan, Sampdoria, Chelsea

Position: Defender, midfielder

2. Marco van Basten

Van Basten comes second in the legendary Dutch list, with over 300 goals and 20 trophies in his illustrious career at Ajax, AC Milan, and the national team. He ranks among the greatest strikers in soccer history despite having a short career after retiring at 28.

Who are the 10 best Mexican soccer players of all time?

Football

The former centre forward also bagged three Ballon d'Ors (1988, 1989, and 1992) and the 1988 UEFA European Championship. He played 58 matches for the national team and scored 24 goals.

Date of birth: 31 October 1964

Age: 59 (as of January 2024)

Birthplace: Utrecht, Netherlands

Career: 1981-1995

Clubs: Ajax, AC Milan

Position: Striker

1. Johan Cruyff

Cruyff is one of the greatest figures in football and among the pioneers of the modern 'Total Football' concept used by the Dutch team in the 1970s. He spent most of his career at Ajax and Barcelona, winning 18 trophies as a player with the two clubs, including three consecutive European Cups with Ajax (1971 - 1973).

The legendary midfielder also revolutionised Barcelona as a manager, guiding them to their first European Cup in 1992. Cruyff made 48 caps, scoring 33 goals for Holland and won three Ballon d'Ors (1971, 1973, and 1974). He was part of the team that finished runner-up in the 1974 World Cup.

Who are the 10 best Norwegian soccer players in the world currently?

Football

Cruyff died of cancer at his home in Barcelona in March 2016, aged 68, but his legacy lives on as the greatest Dutch to ever play football.

Date of birth: 25 April 1947

Birthplace: Amsterdam, Netherlands

Date of death: 24 March 2016

Career: 1964-1984

Clubs: Ajax, Barcelona, Los Angeles Aztecs, Washington Diplomats, Levante, Washington Diplomats, Feyenoord

Position: Midfielder

Best Dutch soccer players right now

The current generation of Holland players consists of some of the most talented footballers, continuing the legacy of their predecessors. Among the best Dutch players currently playing for top clubs include Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk and midfielder Cody Gakpo, Barcelona's midfielder Frenkie de Jong, and Memphis Depay of Atletico Madrid.

Final word

Our list has only sampled the ten best Dutch soccer players in history but excludes other legendary figures who left a mark. They include Marc Overmars, Frank de Boer, Edgar Davids, Wesley Sneijder, Ruud van Nistelrooy, and Clarence Seedorf.
